intro: Sebastiania hispida var. cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in humid, lowland areas. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
